solution_line_template: He buys {eggplant_pounds} pounds of eggplants and {zucchini_pounds} pounds of zucchini so he buys {eggplant_pounds}+{zucchini_pounds} = <<{eggplant_pounds}+{zucchini_pounds}={total_eggplant_zucchini_pounds}>>{total_eggplant_zucchini_pounds} pounds of produce

These {total_eggplant_zucchini_pounds} pounds are ${eggplant_zucchini_price_per_pound} a pound for a total of {total_eggplant_zucchini_pounds}*{eggplant_zucchini_price_per_pound} = $<<{total_eggplant_zucchini_pounds}*{eggplant_zucchini_price_per_pound}={eggplant_zucchini_total_cost}>>{eggplant_zucchini_total_cost}

He needs {tomato_pounds} pounds of tomatoes that are ${tomato_price_per_pound} a pound for a total of {tomato_pounds}*{tomato_price_per_pound} = $<<{tomato_pounds}*{tomato_price_per_pound}={tomato_total_cost}>>{tomato_total_cost}

He needs {onion_pounds} pounds of onions that are ${onion_price_per_pound} a pound so that's {onion_pounds}*{onion_price_per_pound} = $<<{onion_pounds}*{onion_price_per_pound}={onion_total_cost}>>{onion_total_cost}

The basil is sold by the half-pound and he needs a full pound so that's {basil_price_per_half_pound}*{basil_pounds_needed*2} = $<<{basil_price_per_half_pound}*{basil_pounds_needed*2}={basil_total_cost}>>{basil_total_cost}

The eggplants and zucchinis cost ${eggplant_zucchini_total_cost}, the tomatoes are ${tomato_total_cost}, the onions are ${onion_total_cost} and the basil is ${basil_total_cost} for a total of {eggplant_zucchini_total_cost}+{tomato_total_cost}+{onion_total_cost}+{basil_total_cost} = $<<{eggplant_zucchini_total_cost}+{tomato_total_cost}+{onion_total_cost}+{basil_total_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
This recipe makes {total_quarts} quarts and the total price of the vegetables was ${total_cost} so each quart costs {total_cost}/{total_quarts} = $10.00
